questions.text: A 55-year-old man from a rural community in the Thar Desert presents with persistent fever, cough, and weight loss. He also reports painful red nodules on his shins and joint pains.   • • The positive intradermal testing with a regional fungal antigen points towards a geographically specific fungal infection. Coccidioidomycosis is diagnosed in part by skin tests demonstrating delayed-type hypersensitivity. Although the sources specify endemic areas primarily in the USA and Mexico, the association of "desert rheumatism" with the clinical picture and the positive skin test make this the most likely option.

  • • Other Options:
